channel.title: üè¢ Google Research on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Google Research on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Approximating the Top Eigenvector in Random Order Streams
item.description: Random-order stream data necessitates efficient top eigenvector approximation; this paper presents novel algorithms with improved space complexity, achieving near-optimal bounds.

item.title: Auditing Privacy Mechanisms via Label Inference Attacks
item.description: New metrics audit label privatization, revealing differentially private schemes often outperform heuristic methods in the privacy-utility tradeoff.

item.title: Autobidder's Dilemma: Why More Sophisticated Autobidders Lead to Worse Auction Efficiency
item.description: More sophisticated autobidders surprisingly worsen online auction efficiency; a fine-grained analysis reveals that less powerful, uniform bidders lead to better market outcomes.

item.title: Cardinality-Aware Set Prediction and Top-$k$ Classification
item.description: This paper proposes cardinality-aware top-k classification, improving accuracy and efficiency by dynamically adjusting prediction set sizes.

item.title: Contracting with a Learning Agent
item.description: Repeated contracts with learning agents are optimized by a simple dynamic contract: initially linear, then switching to zero-cost, causing the agent’s actions to ‘free-fall’ and yield non-zero rewards…

item.title: Convergence of No-Swap-Regret Dynamics in Self-Play
item.description: In symmetric zero-sum games, no-swap-regret dynamics guarantee strong convergence to Nash Equilibrium under symmetric initial conditions, but this advantage disappears when constraints are relaxed.

item.title: Differentially Private Optimization with Sparse Gradients
item.description: This paper presents new, nearly optimal differentially private algorithms for handling sparse gradients, significantly improving efficiency and scalability in large embedding models.

item.title: Efficiency of the First-Price Auction in the Autobidding World
item.description: First-price auction efficiency in autobidding plummets to 45.7% with mixed bidders, but machine-learned advice restores optimality.

item.title: Embedding-Aligned Language Models
item.description: EAGLE: Guiding LLMs using latent embeddings for controlled text generation.

item.title: Extending Video Masked Autoencoders to 128 frames
item.description: Long-video masked autoencoders (LVMAE) achieve state-of-the-art performance by using an adaptive masking strategy that prioritizes important video tokens, enabling efficient training on 128 frames.

item.title: Generative Forests
item.description: Generative Forests (GFs) revolutionize tabular data generation with a novel forest-based model and a simple boosting algorithm offering strong convergence guarantees, significantly outperforming curre…

item.title: Hyperbolic Embeddings of Supervised Models
item.description: This paper presents a novel approach for embedding supervised models in hyperbolic space, linking loss functions to hyperbolic distances and introducing monotonic decision trees for unambiguous visual…

item.title: IllumiNeRF: 3D Relighting Without Inverse Rendering
item.description: IllumiNeRF: Relightable 3D reconstruction without inverse rendering using image diffusion and NeRF.

item.title: Learning Generalized Linear Programming Value Functions
item.description: Learn optimal LP values faster with a novel neural network method!

item.title: Learning-Augmented Approximation Algorithms for Maximum Cut and Related Problems
item.description: This paper shows how noisy predictions about optimal solutions can improve approximation algorithms for NP-hard problems like MAX-CUT, exceeding classical hardness bounds.

item.title: Linear Regression using Heterogeneous Data Batches
item.description: New algorithm efficiently solves linear regression with heterogeneous data batches, handling diverse input distributions and achieving high accuracy with fewer samples.

item.title: Linear Transformers are Versatile In-Context Learners
item.description: Linear transformers surprisingly learn intricate optimization algorithms, even surpassing baselines on noisy regression problems, showcasing their unexpected learning capabilities.

item.title: Multi-turn Reinforcement Learning with Preference Human Feedback
item.description: Multi-turn RLHF surpasses single-turn methods by aligning LLMs with human preferences across entire conversations, not just individual turns. A novel mirror-descent algorithm, MTPO, is introduced, pr…

item.title: MUVERA: Multi-Vector Retrieval via Fixed Dimensional Encoding
item.description: MUVERA: Revolutionizing multi-vector retrieval with single-vector speed and accuracy!

item.title: On the Inductive Bias of Stacking Towards Improving Reasoning
item.description: MIDAS: A novel training method improves language model reasoning by efficiently stacking middle layers, surprisingly boosting downstream task performance without increasing pretraining perplexity.

item.title: Optical Diffusion Models for Image Generation
item.description: Researchers created an energy-efficient optical system for generating images using light propagation, drastically reducing the latency and energy consumption of diffusion models.

item.title: Orchid: Flexible and Data-Dependent Convolution for Sequence Modeling
item.description: Orchid: a novel deep learning architecture using data-dependent convolution achieves quasilinear scalability and outperforms attention-based models on various sequence modeling tasks.

item.title: Semantic Routing via Autoregressive Modeling
item.description: Learning-based semantic routing, a scalable approach to route planning using rich user queries, is introduced, accompanied by a large-scale public benchmark and a proof-of-concept model demonstrating …

item.title: SequentialAttention++ for Block Sparsification: Differentiable Pruning Meets Combinatorial Optimization
item.description: SequentialAttention++ unites differentiable pruning with combinatorial optimization for efficient and accurate neural network block sparsification, achieving state-of-the-art results.

item.title: SLED: Self Logits Evolution Decoding for Improving Factuality in Large Language Models
item.description: Self Logits Evolution Decoding (SLED) boosts LLM factuality by up to 20% without extra data or fine-tuning!

item.title: The Impact of Geometric Complexity on Neural Collapse in Transfer Learning
item.description: Lowering a neural network’s geometric complexity during pre-training enhances neural collapse and improves transfer learning, especially in few-shot scenarios.

item.title: The Power of Resets in Online Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Leveraging local simulator resets in online reinforcement learning dramatically improves sample efficiency, especially for high-dimensional problems with general function approximation.

item.title: Understanding Transformer Reasoning Capabilities via Graph Algorithms
item.description: Transformers excel at graph reasoning, with logarithmic depth proving necessary and sufficient for parallelizable tasks; single-layer transformers solve retrieval tasks efficiently.

item.title: Who's asking? User personas and the mechanics of latent misalignment
item.description: User personas significantly impact the safety of large language models, bypassing safety filters more effectively than direct prompting methods.
